alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 10:52PM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River At Bellevue affecting Williamson and Davidson Counties. For the Harpeth River...including Bellevue...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Harpeth River At Bellevue. * WHEN...Through tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Water floods Old Harding Pike near Morton Mill Road, and may be subject to closure. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 14.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.3 feet tomorrow morning then begin falling. - Action stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 600 PM CST.
